register.description: legacy identification on port 1
Defines operation mode and data flow on port 1
This register is provided for legacy and possible future extension of protocol. Returns 0x1f

bitfield.description: In the current implementation it must be always written 31, meaning the frame payload size is 32 bit.

register.description: Define the state of the transmitter on port 1
Transmitter state for FIFO 0..7Each bit gives the state of transmit FIFOs:0x1 FIFO full0x0 FIFO not full

bitfield.description: Each bit gives the state of transmit buffer register:0x0: buffer is not full0x1: buffer is full

register.description: Transmission bit rate divisor for port 1

bitfield.description: This bitfield B has a range [0..255] and it programs a division factor [1..256], B+1 example: writing 0 divides by 1, writing 1 divides by 2, writing 2 divides by 3, etc

register.description: Transmit break strobe register on port 1

bitfield.description: Send a break signal on the port

register.description: Number of active channels on port 1 (this will determine the number of the used channel descriptor bits on the MIPI port as well)It can be 1,2,4,8 or 16.

bitfield.description: Number of active channels up to 16

bitenum.description: one logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 0
four logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 2
four logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 2
eight logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 3
sixteen logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 4

register.description: Arbitration type for the transmit FIFOs on port 1.

Transmit register for FIFO 0..7Important:Write access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Transmit register for FIFO 0..7Important:Write access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Transmit register for FIFO 0..7Important:Write access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Transmit register with byte swapping for FIFO 0..7Important:Write access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Transmit register with byte swapping for FIFO 0..7Important:Write access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Transmit register with byte swapping for FIFO 0..7Important:Write access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!
TX FIFO configuration register. One register per FIFO

bitfield.description: Number of empty TX FIFO locations that will activate interrupt or DMA requests. DMA requests (if enabled) or interrupt assertion (if enabled) is triggered if the number of free locations in FIFO is less than the THRESHOLD value. 0x0: less than 8 words in the FIFO 0x1: less than 1 words in the FIFO 0x2: less than 2 words in the FIFO ............................................................... 0x8: less than 8 words in the FIFO 0x9 through 0xF: no request generated
Associates the FIFO to a HSI port
Associates the TX FIFO to a HSI logical channel number (0-15):0x0: logical channel number 00x1: logical channel number 10xF: logical channel number 15

register.description: TX FIFO configuration register. One register per FIFO

bitfield.description: Number of empty TX FIFO locations that will activate interrupt or DMA requests. register.description: Legacy Identification
Defines operation mode and data flow on port 1
legacy returns 0x1f
Receiver state on port 1
State of receiver buffer register for port 1

bitfield.description: Each bit gives the state of receiver buffer register:0x0: buffer is not full0x1: buffer is full

register.description: Break detected on port 1
Error detection state register for port 1
Error detection acknowledge register on port 1: write 1 to clear
Number of active channels on port 1 (this will determine the number of the used channel descriptor bits on the MIPI port as well)It can be 1,2,4,8 or 16.

bitenum.description: one logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 0
two logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 1
four logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 2
eight logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 3
sexteen logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 4

register.description: Overrun detection state register for those receive FIFOs which are mapped to port 1.

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is detected on channel n

register.description: Overrun acknowledge register for those receive FIFOs which are mapped to port 1.

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is acknowledged on channel n

register.description: Counters setting register for port 1

bitfield.description: Setting for Frame Burst Counter. Set n as a value will result the n+1 counter value.
Setting for Tailing Bit Counter. Set n as a value will result the n+1 counter value.
Setting for Frame Timeout counter. Set n as a value will result the n+1 counter value.

register.description: Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Byte swapped receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Byte swapped receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Byte swapped receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Byte swapped receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Byte swapped receive register for receive FIFO 0..7Important:Read access to the register with 0x3 and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the upper 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0xC). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!
RX FIFO Configuration register. One register per FIFO

bitfield.description: Number of words available in the RX FIFO for reading R
Associates the RX FIFO to a HSI port
Associates RX FIFO to a HSI logical channel0x0: logical channel number 00x1: logical channel number 10xF: logical channel number 15

register.description: Receive bit rate divisor for port 1.This needs to be set for correct protocol timing detection (tailing timeout, frame timeout).

bitfield.description: The functional clock source divided by this value will be used as a clock base for the receive counters.Set n as a value will result the n+1 divisor value.

register.description: legacy identification on port 2
Defines operation mode and data flow on port 2
This register is provided for legacy and possible future extension of protocol. Returns 0x1f

bitfield.description: In the current implementation it must be always written 31, meaning the frame payload size is 32 bit.

register.description: Define the state of the transmitter on port 2
Transmitter state for buffer 8..15Each bit gives the state of transmit FIFOs:0x1 FIFO full0x0 FIFO not full

bitfield.description: Each bit gives the state of transmit buffer register:0x0: buffer is not full0x1: buffer is full

register.description: Transmission bit rate divisor for port 2

bitfield.description: This bitfield B has a range [0..255] and it programs a division factor [1..256], B+1 example: writing 0 divides by 1, writing 1 divides by 2, writing 2 divides by 3, etc

register.description: Transmit break strobe register on port 2

bitfield.description: Send a break signal on the port

register.description: Number of active channels on port 2 (this will determine the number of the used channel descriptor bits on the MIPI port as well)It can be 1,2,4,8 or 16.

bitfield.description: Number of active channels up to 16

bitenum.description: one logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 0
four logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 2
four logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 2
eight logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 3
sixteen logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 4

register.description: Arbitration type for the transmit FIFOs on port 2.

Transmit register for FIFO 8..15Important:Write access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Transmit register for FIFO 8..15Important:Write access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will load its value into the transmit FIFO.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be written first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Legacy Identification
Defines operation mode and data flow on port 2
legacy returns 0x1f
Receiver state on port 2
State of receiver buffer register for port 2

bitfield.description: Each bit gives the state of receiver buffer register:0x0: buffer is not full0x1: buffer is full

register.description: Break detected on port 2
Error detection state register for port 2
Error detection acknowledge register on port 2: write 1 to clear
Number of active channels on port 2 (this will determine the number of the used channel descriptor bits on the MIPI port as well)It can be 1,2,4,8 or 16.

bitenum.description: one logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 0
two logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 1
four logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 2
eight logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 3
sexteen logical channel used, num. of the channel descriptor bits is 4

register.description: Overrun detection state register for those receive FIFOs which are mapped to port 2.

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is detected on channel n

register.description: Overrun acknowledge register for those receive FIFOs which are mapped to port 2.

bitfield.description: Bit n is set when overrun is acknowledged on channel n

register.description: Counters setting register for port 2

bitfield.description: Setting for Frame Burst Counter. Set n as a value will result the n+1 counter value.
Setting for Tailing Bit Counter. Set n as a value will result the n+1 counter value.
Setting for Frame Timeout counter. Set n as a value will result the n+1 counter value.

register.description: Receive register for receive FIFO 8..15Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Receive register for receive FIFO 8..15Important:Read access to the register with 0xC and 0xF byteen will remove the receive FIFO related item.In case of using only 16 bit accesses the lower 2 bytes must be read first (byteen 0x3). Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!

Between two consecutive 16 bit FIFO related access there can not be any other FIFO related OCP access!
Receive bit rate divisor for port 2.This needs to be set for correct protocol timing detection (tailing timeout, frame timeout).

bitfield.description: The functional clock source divided by this value will be used as a clock base for the receive counters.Set n as a value will result the n+1 divisor value.
